list_definition.definition: to mend; to make (something) that is damaged or has broken down work again; to restore to good condition

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She’s repairing a broken lock / torn jacket.

list_definition.definition: to put right or make up for

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Nothing can repair the harm done by your foolish remarks.

list_definition.definition: the act of repairing something damaged or broken down

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I put my car into the garage for repairs
The road is in bad repair
The house is in a good state of repair.

list_ex_of_english: Earlier methods relied on sutures to repair the hernia under tension, whereas newer methods involved placing a synthetic mesh over the defect without tension.
Such technical arbitrariness may prove difficult someday when repairs must be made.
Consider the uptake of the verb measure by a child aged 2;2 from an embedded repair, illustrated in ex.
We speculate that, earlier during development, the aorta was damaged, became inflamed and was repaired, with fibrosis obliterating the elastic tissue.
The ascending aorta was bulbous, but narrowed at the transverse arch and at the site of repair of the aortic coarctation.
Rather than simply closing the septal defect, relieving the pulmonary stenosis, and performing an atrial switch, univentricular repair was preferred in these patients.
In four patients, it was placed through the brachiocephalic artery permitting selective perfusion of the brain during repair of the aortic arch.
Those with descending aortic aneurysm underwent conduit placement, and those with valve disease underwent repair or replacement.
